title: Isaac Gilinski Sragowicz
text:
Isaac Gilinski Sragowicz ( born 19 February 1934) is a Colombian banker and financier currently serving as <a href="Ambassador%20of%20Colombia%20to%20Israel">Ambassador of Colombia to Israel</a>.
Ambassadorship.
Gilinski was appointed <a href="Ambassador%20of%20Colombia%20to%20Israel">Ambassador of Colombia to Israel</a> by <a href="President%20of%20Colombia">President</a> <a href="%C3%81lvaro%20Uribe%20V%C3%A9lez">Álvaro Uribe Vélez</a> on 28 October 2009 in a ceremony of protocol that took place at the <a href="Palace%20of%20Nari%C3%B1o">Palace of Nariño</a>; he later presented his <a href="Letters%20of%20Credence">Letters of Credence</a> in a ceremony of protocol at <a href="Beit%20HaNassi">Beit HaNassi</a> to the <a href="President%20of%20Israel">President of Israel</a>, <a href="Shimon%20Peres">Shimon Peres</a>, on 11 January 2010. Gilinski's brother, Lazar, had also served as Ambassador of Colombia to Israel in the 80's.
Personal life.
Born Isaac Gilinski Sragowicz on 19 February 1934 in <a href="Barranquilla">Barranquilla</a>, he is the son of <a href="Lithuanian%20Jews">Lithuanian Jewish</a> immigrants who settled in that city from <a href="Israel">Israel</a> in the 1920s. He is married to Perla Bacal Zweiban since 1957, with whom he had three children: <a href="Jaime%20Gilinski%20Bacal">Jaime</a>, Rutie, Tania.
